a bouncer to follow up, 138kph, through to Paine
full outside off, left alone
very full outside off, driven to point
good length, angled in at off stump, trapped off the inside and lodges behind the pad flap
full outside off, beats the outside edge as he pushes forward
back of a length at off stump, defended to midwicket
a bouncer which he has to duck down quite sharply to avoid
full outside off, scoots off a thick edge through gully
staying round the wicket, full outside off, defended to cover
good length at off stump, 138kph, defended

Cummins wins the battle! Latham's concentration lapses for a second. This ball is a touch wider, he goes for the drive away from his body, and it's a thick edge for Paine. The relentlessness of Cummins takes the honours
a sharp bumper, angling into the body and it rushes past Southee's shoulder
just out of Cummins' reach to his left! A fuller ball outside off, Southee pushing at it with his weight bat. Cummins can't quite dive across
full and straight, flicked in the air backward of square and wide of long leg
a yorker at off stump, jabbed away
a bouncer outside off, Santner sways out of the line
full outside off, defended on the front foot
defended from off stump to mid-on
138kph, a bouncer, and again he goes down in his stance

edged, caught behind! It just felt like a matter of time. Full outside off, Santner edging forward, the ball just grazes the outside edge as it straighten on the angle from round the wicket. Classy bowling from Pattinson

oh dear, gone with a direct hit! Confusion all over the place. Southee pushed a length ball into the office, they couldn't decide over the single. Lyon threw to the keeper's end, whereas Southee was miles short at the other
round the wicket, banged in short, he gets underneath it
another bouncer, it's very short, Wagner comfortably (relatively) ducks
dropped at short leg by Wade! A short ball at the chest, made him play, Wagner fended it off the splice and Wade couldn't take it in front of his face
touch fuller, cannons into the pad but it's high and angling down leg
back of a length at off stump, 138kph, defended
edged, through the gap in the slips...full at off stump, goes for the drive, and it scoots away to third man. May as well pack the cordon
full and straight, flicked to long leg
round the wicket, short outside off, sways out of the line
toe ends a pull, doesn't reach Paine! A short ball outside off, he tries to fetch the pull
full at the stumps, flicked into midwicket
short outside off, flirts at it but doesn't get the edge
horrid short ball! The length that makes him play, right at the throat, fended down off his gloves away from short leg
short outside off, flapped away in the air but between gully and backward point
short, wide outside off, Southee is walking across the crease then spars at it
again he chases a short delivery outside off and doesn't make contact
short of a length, straight, Southee stays leg side and defends towards point
regulation edge, five for Cummins! That was a working over. Short of a length outside off, Southee plays away from his body again and this time it's a thin edge. Another one for Paine
full, wide outside off, a huge swing and a miss
that's come off the back of a bat! A short ball, goes for the book and it flies over the slips
back of a length at off stump, defended to gully
loops into the off side off the toe end! Short, goes for the pull, skews in the air but lands safe. Not coming off the middle for Wagner
short, this time he's beaten over the top edge as he hooks
full at off stump, 139kph, pushed to mid-off
round the wicket, short, Boult steps away and has a mighty heave to the leg side
short at the chest, fended down in front of short leg...he didn't know much about that
where's that gone?! He's moving all over the place, gets an inside edge on 151kph full delivery and it sticks behind his back pad flap
short outside off, he jumps right across the crease and flicks to long leg...huge cheers from the crowd
round the wicket, full at the stumps, an excellent off drive from Wagner as he stands still and plays through the line
short outside leg, 145kph, he ducks underneath
tossed up outside off, he's down the pitch straightaway and drives back to Lyon
into the crowd! 'That's big', Paine says...indeed it is. A skip down the pitch and lovely swing through the line
uses his feet and then blocks
lofted into deep midwicket, wasn't to the pitch and he swung it one handed into the deep
reverse sweep, loops off the top edge and glove over the slip
all the way again! He came down the pitch, swung it a long way into the air but it also had the legs to clear long-on
back of a length, straight, Boult gives himself room and misses his swipe
keeps it short of a length, blocked to the off side
short again, follows him as he moves to leg, flies over the top edge
touch fuller, angled in at the pads, deflected towards short leg
bowled round his legs! Gets the yorker in, Boult moving right across his crease, he misses and the leg stump gets flicked
130kph, good length wide of off, he leaves
131kph, back of a length, squared up a touch but he defends off the back foot
132kph, fuller on off, he hangs back but pushes this firmly to mid on
131kph, good length and some shape outside off, beats him as he prods with no footwork
132kph, back of a length on off, this bounces a touch, he works this behind square to fine leg
130kph, swinging down leg, he shuffles across, it runs off pad and runs fine for four leg byes! Boult appealed in hope but no one else went up
122kph, length inswinger, he's back and defending
121kph, back of a length on middle, he's back and defending to midwicket
126kph, fuller outswinger, he leans forward and pushes gently to mid off

Huge lbw appeal! Not out is the call. New Zealand review. This was back of a length, shaping back a long way from around the wicket, he went back and it looks like he's jammed it off the edge onto pad. Big mark on the bat on hot spot. The debate here is whether it was bat or pad first. It was quite close but it was bat first. Not out. It might have been outside the line too. New Zealand lose the review.
130kph, fuller length wide of off, shaping back a touch, he leaves
129kph, fuller outside off, he drives but mistimes it to mid off
128kph, back of a length, he's back and defending confidently
130kph, fuller outside off, he pushes firmly on the front foot
fuller again on off, he pushes on the front foot to mid off
140kph, angled wide of off, he pushes away from his body, guides it to gully who misfields and he's off the mark!
back of a length, 132kph, he's squared up defending and it runs to gully
fuller on off, he defends on the front foot

beaten feeling for a 130kph, length ball that was just angled across him
nearly chopped on! 129kph, back of a length, wide of off, he is back and defending with an angled bat, it comes off inside edge and runs past leg stump
fuller, angled across the right hander, he defends to point and a misfield from Santner allows them to pinch a single. Good running

131kph, straying down leg, he glances this with control behind square wide of fine leg
135kph, wide swinging half volley and he crunches a superb cover drive! Right out of the middle of the bat. Great footwork. He had to wait a long time for that ball but put it away
134kph, back of a length on off, he's back and across and defending

length ball outside off, hint of swing, square driven wide of point

defended back down the pitch

worked from off stump to midwicket

more width and Warner lays into it with a cover drive, Santner gets around the boundary
back of a length, straight, worked off the hip to square leg
does the same, works this off the pads into midwicket
edged, wide of second slip! Full outside off, brings Warner forward, a thick edge just evades Southee
big stride forward this time, defends the full delivery to mid-off
short outside off, 132kph, pulled in front of square
good length outside off, Burns is across the crease and plays this unconvincingly off a thick edge to gully

length ball outside off, feeling away from his body as he sends it to gully

fuller, he drives but isn't in an ideal position with his weight a little back

defended
back of a length outside off, dabbed into the point area to bring up the fifty stand
full on off stump, 132kph, he slices across the drive a touch and finds cover
that will make him feel better! Picks up a short-of-a-length delivery from outside off and pulls it handsomely over square leg
full at off stump, played to the off side from a thickish outside edge
round the wicket, very wide outside off, and called
good length, closer to off stump, defended
taps a length ball into the covers and takes the quick single

he was shaping for a big slog sweep for a moment before opting to defend
outside off, short of a length, played to midwicket
skips down the pitch and flicks this very firmly through midwicket, Williamson at long-on keeps it to a single

finds cover! Giving himself room outside leg against a short-of-a-length delivery, makes good connection but it's straight to the man in front of square
well bowled, round the wicket, full and straight, clipped to backward square leg

finds the gap this time, off the back foot to deep cover
on off stump, defended
steps back outside leg, drives off the back foot to cover

nicely bowled, gets this fuller at off stump, takes a thick edge towards short third man

pulled to long leg
appeal for lbw as this spears into the pads from round the wicket, he delivers from wide on the crease. Inside edge.

has to get the dive out to make the single after work it off the pads into square leg

driven to mid-off who is deep enough to allow the single
round the wicket, short over leg stump, and the umpire's decide it's too short

pulled to square leg, can't find the gap
short of a length into leg stump, tucked to long leg

on the toes, clipped through square leg and that's good running to make the second
whipped off the pads backward of square

sweeps this off around leg stump, placed wide of deep square and they make a third from it. The lead goes to 400

hangs it outside off and Burns watches it go through

opens the face and drives into the covers

tight run! Driven off the back foot to cover but he's able to scamper through
strides forward and pushes to the covers
well, is this a sign? Full outside off, Burns opens his shoulders and launches it straight down the ground
nearly drags on! Back of a length, defends, goes into his pads and bounces over off stump
comes forward and pushes to cover

bouncer, angled over off, he gets underneath it

drifting down the leg side at 84kph, nice take by Watling
drifting in and some purchase, he's back and defending to point
drifting in and sliding on, he just jammed the bat down getting an inside edge onto pad
this grips and bounces and catches the glove! It pops safely wide of the keeper! No slip in place
drifting into leg stump, he clips this with the drift behind square
short and climbing into the ribs, he's back and tucking this to fine leg
shorter into the hip, he's back and glancing this past leg gully, they run sharply to get two
A cross court forehand pull through midwicket! 125kph, short ball, he cleared the front leg and played a Rafa Nadal style cross court forehand! Smashed it through midwicket

he charges early to a length ball and is forced to defend

caught behind! A little bottom edge trying to dab a late cut. Pushed through wide of off, he tried to run it fine but got a tickle off the glove and Watling takes a nice catch. It took awhile for Marais Erasmus to give it out but there was never any doubt. Perhaps he was waiting for Burns to walk
127kph, bouncer, over off, he shapes to pull and bails out

caught at backward square! 200 Test wickets for Wagner! He's the second-fastest Black Cap behind Sir Richard Hadlee to the milestone. Another short ball, another wicket. It was only just above hip high, he tried to paddle a pull shot around the corner, got a top edge that just loops to Southee who is positioned at a catching backward square! Could not have picked him out better if he tried
